byline.contributor: Shuaib Almosawa reported from Sana, and Kareem Fahim reported from Amman, Jordan.
byline.original: By SHUAIB ALMOSAWA and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Saudi Arabia says it will cease military offensive against Houthis in Yemen for five days in order to allow for distribution of humanitarian aid supplies to civilians.
lead_paragraph: A Saudi-led military coalition announced on Saturday that a five-day humanitarian cease-fire would take effect in Yemen starting Sunday evening at the request of Yemen’s exiled president.

headline.main: Saudi Forces Agree to Halt in Yemen War
headline.print_headline: Saudi Forces Agree to Halt in Yemen War

snippet: A Saudi-led military coalition announced on Saturday that a five-day humanitarian cease-fire would take effect in Yemen starting Sunday evening at the request of Yemen’s exiled president.
